CLUB BOSS COMING TO DORTMUND IS Barca now serious ABOUT Dembélé?

The papers "L'Equipe" and "El Mundo Deportivo" report that next week, Barca sport director Robert Fernandez (55) will travel to Germany to enter into negotiations and allegedly offer 100 million. However, he did not sign up for BILD information yet.

On Thursday, BILD coach Peter Bosz (53) spoke to the staff. The Dutchman: "This is not yet an issue. If I had to worry about anything that might happen, then I sleep badly. "

A year ago, Dortmund won the French for 15 million of Stade Rennes. Already in mid-June there should have been an offer from Barcelona. Barca offered 50 million euros - much too little for BVB! Now the Spaniards can refine thanks to the Neymar coal.

BILD knows: Internally, BVB is assuming that Dembélé will be the first Bundesliga transfer in the three-digit million range. With a 100 million offer would be at least talk-ready.

In October 2016, "El Mundo Deportivo" reported that Dembélé Barca-Sportchef Fernandez had promised: "One day I will play for Barca ..."

Ernesto Valverde is the one who has requested the hiring of a central one after the tests realized during the tour by the United States and he himself suggested the name of Iñigo, that already was felt last year.

The Barça wanted to include some player in the operation, as Samper or Munir but the Real has closed in band.

From now on everything will be precipitated, as the Catalan club is resolutely determined to face the termination clause. Iñigo would have on the table a proposal for five seasons, although he has not yet officially informed Real that he will leave the club. It will do so over the next few days.
